poem:
**The Cost of Complacency**

In the glass jar, whispers swirl  
of tiny, unseen tyrants—  
a microcosmic uprising,  
forgers of their own arsenal.  
By 2050, they toll our bell,  
inch deep in pills and pounds—  
the price of looking away.  
Through petri-dish skies,  
we ignore their silenced roar,  
as economies wither beneath  
a billion unmet eyes.
